edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class KSReadWriteState

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.KSReadWriteState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class KSReadWriteState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The KSReadWriteState class is used by the KSWriter and KSReader classes when serializing and deserializing robot and world state information associated with recorded files.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected  float[] data
          Information regarding the robot's state.
protected  int heldID
          The id number of any object held in the gripper, 0 if nothing is held.
protected  boolean worldChange
          Set to true if something other than the robot changed in the arena, false otherwise.
protected  java.util.Vector worldObjects
          If worldChange is true, then this field will refer to the collection of world objects at the particular time step when the change occured.
 
Constructor Summary
KSReadWriteState()
          Allocate a new KSReadWriteState object, setting fields to default values.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

data

protected float[] data
Information regarding the robot's state. Includes sensor values, position, orientation, gripper/arm states, motor speeds....

worldChange

protected boolean worldChange
Set to true if something other than the robot changed in the arena, false otherwise.

worldObjects

protected java.util.Vector worldObjects
If worldChange is true, then this field will refer to the collection of world objects at the particular time step when the change occured.

heldID

protected int heldID
The id number of any object held in the gripper, 0 if nothing is held.

Constructor Detail

KSReadWriteState

public KSReadWriteState()
Allocate a new KSReadWriteState object, setting fields to default values.
